intro: Pabstiella pellifeloidis f. albina, commonly known as the white-flowered form of the genus Pabstiella, is a rare and unique plant species characterized by its striking white petals. It belongs to the family Pabstiellaceae and is distinguished by its delicate, clustered inflorescences. The plant typically grows in shaded, moist environments, often found in temperate regions with specific soil conditions. Its foliage is usually green, with a slightly waxy texture, and it produces small, inconspicuous fruits. Due to its limited distribution and specific ecological requirements, it is considered a rare and endangered species in its native habitat.
